articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military said on Thursday it had struck hundreds of Hezbollah rocket launchers that had been targeted at Israel.
articles.title: UN peacekeepers in Lebanon urge de-escalation after heavy airstrikes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli jets and artillery hit multiple targets in southern Lebanon overnight, Israel's military said on Thursday, amid spiralling tensions following the mass attack on Hezbollah communications devices this week.
articles.title: Israeli strikes hit multiple targets in Lebanon

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces killed at least 14 Palestinians in tank and air strikes on north and central areas of the Gaza Strip on Friday, medics said, as tanks advanced further into northwest Rafah near the border with Egypt.
articles.title: Israeli forces deepen raid in Rafah, kill 14 people across Gaza

articles.author: Barbara Erling, Janis Laizans
articles.description: A social media producer whose accounts would normally show people where to eat out and relax in the historic Polish city of Wroclaw has shifted his focus to showing people where they can volunteer to protect the city against flood waters.
articles.title: Social media mobilises Poles to battle floods in historic city

articles.author: Charlotte Van Campenhout
articles.description: A knife-wielding assailant stabbed and killed a man in the Dutch port city of Rotterdam on Thursday night before he was overpowered by police and bystanders, police said.
articles.title: One dead in Rotterdam stabbing, bystanders overpower suspect

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: Tensions brewing in Asia's trade-rich waters top the agenda as U.S. President Joe Biden welcomes leaders from Australia, India and Japan to his Delaware hometown for a diplomatic push to counter China in the waning months of his presidency.
articles.title: Biden, 'Quad' leaders to talk maritime security as China tensions grow

articles.author: Navesh Chitrakar
articles.description: Tamils form 12% of the country's 22 million population, but have long been electorally sidelined.
articles.title: For Sri Lanka's minority Tamils, election does not offer hope

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia warned the West and Ukraine on Friday of "disastrous consequences" if Kyiv moved against close Russian ally Belarus, making clear it would intervene to defend a country where it has deployed tactical nuclear weapons.
articles.title: Russia warns West and Ukraine of 'disastrous consequences' if Kyiv moves against Belarus
Components for pagers used in Lebanon blasts are not from Taiwan, minister says

articles.author: Tim Kelly, Casey Hall, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: The lethal hack of Hezbollah's Asian-branded pagers and walkie-talkies has sparked an intense search for the devices' path, revealing a murky market for older technologies where buyers may have few assurances about what they are getting.
articles.title: Hack of Hezbollah devices exposes dark corners of Asia supply chains
